title: What is the meaning of this song 'mujhe chod do mere haal pe jinda hu yaar'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Mujhe chhod do... mere haal pe  Leave me.. In my own condition Zinda hoon yaar kaafi hai  I am alive friend and that is enough Mujhe Chhod Do... Mere Haal Pe  Leave me... in my own condition Zinda Hoon Yaar Kaafi Hai  I am alive friend and that is enough Ohhh... Kaafi Hai, Kaafi Hai That is enough Hawaaon se jo Manga hissa mera When I asked the winds for my share  To badle mein hawa ne saans di Instead it gave me breath  Akelepan Se Chhedi Jab Guftagoo When I started a conversation with loneliness Mere Dil Ne Awaaz Di Instead my heart talked to me  Mere Haathon Hua Jo Kissa Shuru The events which were started by me Use Pura To Karna Hai Mujhe It has to be completed by me  Qabar Par Mere Sar Utha Kar Khadi Ho Zindagi, Aise Marna Hai Mujhe... Life proudly stands on my grave.. I want to die such a death Kuchh Maangna Baaki Nahi  There's nothing more to ask Jitna Mila Kaafi Hai... Whatever I have received, it's enough Zinda Hoon Yaar Kaafi Hai... I am alive friend and that is enough Mujhe Chhod Do... Mere Haal Pe  Leave me... in my own condition Zinda Hoon Yaar Kaafi Hai  I am alive friend and that is enough Mujhe Chhod Do... Mere Haal Pe  Leave me... in my own condition Zinda Hoon Yaar Kaafi Hai  I am alive friend and that is enough Mujhe Chhod Do... Leave me Mere Haal Pe...  In my own condition

I think Pratibha has done a good job translating the song. I’ll avoid doing the same and focus on one interpretation instead. My interpretation of this song; in particular if you take it out of context from the movie itself and treat it as an independent work of art; is that this song is about life itself and its origin in a cosmos that doesn’t care. It’s how life was born the very first time out of sheer chance and sustained itself against all odds. It’s about the fight to survive in a universe bereft of any other life; being alive alone is an achievement in in-of itself. The most beautiful bits in this song include the stanza below: Hawaaon se jo Manga hissa mera To badle mein hawa ne saans di Akelepan Se Chhedi Jab Guftagoo Mere Dil Ne Awaaz Di Mere Haathon Hua Jo Kissa Shuru Use Pura To Karna Hai Mujhe Qabar Par Mere Sar Utha Kar Khadi Ho Zindagi, Aise Marna Hai Mujhe... My interpretation is of life taking hold of it’s first breath as your right from the raw forces of nature (Hawaaon se…). Next is about being able to replicate cells (Akelepan se… ) and finally about the tree of life itself (Mere haathon hua… ). It’s about knowing that this life is going to be done but at the same time being aware of having started something much bigger than itself and that life will live on(Qabar par mere.. ). I find this song very beautiful and uplifting. I hope you find my interpretation interesting.
